title: Was Socrates Black? And if he wasn't, how does he look Black? - Quora

response.answer_text: He did have some feature that might consider African like snub nose wide nostrils, and a pot belly, well ok the snub nose anyway, but that is not unique to Black people. however he was a native born Athenian you could only be a full Athenian citizen at the time if both parents were Athenians and unless, we claim the Ancient Greek were secretly all black this Makes him being black very unlikely. further more we a have detailed and not very flattering description of Socrates. on which this bust is based, which he himself joked about see Xenophons sypoism, dark skin however is not mentioned here nor in the play about Scrates clouds where again in his own life time he made fun of.
Its not likely he was black. He was a Greek born in Athens. Socrates - Simple English Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
